com.complexible.common.netty.codec

Class ProtocolPrepender

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelOutboundHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.handler.codec.MessageToByteEncoder<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf>
          • com.complexible.common.netty.codec.ProtocolPrepender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler, io.netty.channel.ChannelOutboundHandler

    public final class ProtocolPrepender
extends io.netty.handler.codec.MessageToByteEncoder<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf>

    Simple Netty handler that will prefix an outbound byte buffer with a specified byte prefix.

    Since:
    2.0
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Michael Grove, Fernando Hernandez

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProtocolPrepender

        public ProtocolPrepender(byte[] theBuffer,
                 byte[] theRead,
                 byte[] theWrite,
                 io.netty.util.AttributeKey<Boolean> theWriteAttr,
                 boolean theAlwaysDelimit)
        Create a new ProtocolPrepender
        Parameters:
        theBuffer - the buffer containing the data to prepend to the outgoing traffic
        theRead - the buffer containing the data to prepend for a READ request
        theWrite - the buffer containing the data to prepend for a WRITE request
        theWriteAttr - the channel's AttributeKey that contains the R/W flag
        theAlwaysDelimit - true to always prepend outbound traffic with the specified byte array. when false only the first outbound message will be prefixed.
